weather_report:
As the night descends upon Evanston, temperatures hover in the mid to high 20s, producing a crisp and cool atmosphere, perfect for those who relish the beauty of winter nights. A light snow dances softly in the air, set against a backdrop of cloudy skies, while gusty winds whip from the west-northwest, creating a slightly wild ambiance. The wave conditions along Lake Michigan are likely calm, though the hint of snow may obscure visibility, adding a touch of winter magic to the shoreline.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, the forecast suggests a continued chance of snow and intermittent flurries throughout the morning, with temperatures peaking near 26 degrees. The wind will remain brisk, which may make it feel even chillier. As winter takes firm hold in this region, these temperatures are consistent with seasonal norms, embodying the character of late November in northern Illinois. Residents venturing outside should bundle up—warm coats, hats, and gloves are essential attire. Ideal activities include enjoying a contemplative stroll along the beach or cozying up with a warm drink indoors, perfect for savoring the serene beauty of a snowy night.
